author: Special Correspondent
text:
Forging of electoral alliance by the Dravidian parties with caste-based political outfits that were inciting caste fanaticism and male chauvinism only gave recognition to such organisations, the Communist Party of India (Marxist) has charged.

Talking to reporters here on Sunday, party leader U. Vasuki alleged that it was the poor handling of honour killings by the present government and the police in the past that encouraged such outfights to carry out “honour” killings.

Condemning those inciting fanaticism and violence in the name of caste honour in social media, Ms. Vasuki wanted stringent action against such persons. Someone in the name of an advocate had posted messages online that he would render legal help for anyone who committed “honour” killing.

Ms. Vasuki also faulted Chief Minister Jayalalithaa for not condemning the murder of Dalit youth Sankar. “While the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam reacted to it after three days, Pattali Makkal Katchi leader S. Ramadoss belittled the serious issue,” she charged.

“When the issue was raised with Mr. Ramadoss during a press conference, he asked the journalist to focus on other important issues he had spoken about. He implied that the murder of a Dalit youth was not so important for him. People should identify such parties,” Ms. Vasuki said.

“If the Chief Minister’s claim of having fulfilled the promise of increasing the farmers’ income by two to three times is true, Azhagar, a farmer from Ariyalur, would have committed suicide and another farmer, Balan of Thanjavur, would not have struggled to repay his last two dues (for a tractor loan),” she noted.
title: “Dravidian parties recognise outfits inciting honour killings”
